name: pointe
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a position in which someone is dancing on the toes of their shoes: They perform ballet numbers complete with jetés and pointes.
Robert Nieznanski/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ U ] (also pointe work) a style of dancing which is done on the toes of the shoes: Georgian dances involve men doing pointe work, or dancing on curled toes.on pointe Ballerinas danced around the stage on pointe.en pointe A dancer is said to be en pointe when all the body weight is supported on the tips of the toes.
More examplesFewer examplesPointes have an enormous part to play in classical ballet.She leapt onto her pointes with catlike ease. A "pointe" is the ballet figure where one stands on tiptoes.This ballet features a great deal of tricky and demanding pointe work.The production features a Swan Queen who balances, on pointe, on top of her partner's head.The scene features 16 white swans, en pointe in the mist by the lake, arms gracefully stroking the air in imaginary flight.

pointes
ballet shoes with special thick strong parts at the front for dancing on the toes: Getting used to wearing pointes is a painful process. Why did your hang up your pointes?
the thick strong toes of a ballet dancer's shoes: The prima ballerina danced forward on her pointes. When she realizes she loves Aminta, she rises slowly on to pointes with touching gentleness.
